name: cloying
content:
cloying adjective
(TOO SWEET)
Add to word list
Add to word list
disapproving tasting or smelling too sweet and therefore unpleasant: This is a wonderful wine - honeyed and rich without being remotely cloying. The room was filled with the cloying scent of lilies.
More examplesFewer examplesThe pie filling is rich and dark without the cloying qualities of mincemeat.Although the perfume is intense, it is far from cloying.

cloying adjective
(TOO EMOTIONAL)
disapproving expressing feelings of love or kindness in a way that is annoying because it does not seem real: She criticized the cloying sentimentality of the film. The story is heartwarming but never cloying.
More examplesFewer examplesMost of the album consists of cloying ballads.Love stories can be too cloying, and dramas can be too dark.
